text: CHAPTER 23-16
label: HH1

text: LICENSING MEDICAL HOSPITALS
label: TITLE

text: 23-16-01. Licensure of medical hospitals and state hospitals. After July 1, 1947, no
label: BODY

text: person, partnership, association, corporation, limited liability company, county or municipal
label: BODY

text: corporation, or agency thereof, which maintains and operates organized facilities for the
label: BODY

text: diagnosis, treatment, or care of two or more nonrelated persons suffering from illness, injury, or
label: BODY

text: deformity or where obstetrical or other care is rendered over a period exceeding twenty-four
label: BODY

text: hours, may be established, conducted, or maintained in the state of North Dakota without
label: BODY

text: obtaining annually a license therefor in the manner hereinafter provided in sections 23-16-02 and
label: BODY

text: Chiropractic hospitals, sanatoriums, and hospitals such as those for unmarried
label: BODY

text: mothers maintained and operated by the department of human services are not required to
label: BODY

text: obtain a license under this chapter.
label: BODY

text: In the case of emergency or transfer beds attached to and forming a part of a licensed
label: BODY

text: medical doctor's office, the state department of health has the right of inspection, but no license
label: BODY

text: may be required under the provisions of this chapter when the number of such beds does not
label: BODY

text: exceed four.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-01.1. Moratorium on expansion of long-term care bed capacity.
label: BODY

text: Notwithstanding sections 23-16-06 and 23-16-10, except when a facility reverts
label: BODY

text: basic care beds to nursing facility beds, nursing facility beds may not be added to
label: BODY

text: the state's licensed bed capacity during the period between August 1, 2009, and
label: BODY

text: July 31, 2011. A nursing facility may not convert licensed nursing bed capacity to
label: BODY

text: basic care bed capacity or convert basic care beds back to nursing facility beds
label: BODY

text: more than one time in a twelve-month period if the beds have been licensed as
label: BODY

text: basic care.
label: BODY

text: Transfers of beds from one facility to another entity is permitted.
label: BODY

text: Transferred
label: BODY

text: nursing facility beds must become licensed within forty-eight months of transfer.
label: BODY

text: Nursing facility beds transferred before August 1, 2005, which are awaiting nursing
label: BODY

text: facility licensure, may be converted to basic care licensure.
label: BODY

text: A nursing facility may convert licensed nursing facility bed capacity to basic care. If
label: BODY

text: the converted beds remain in the same facility and are not transferred, the beds may
label: BODY

text: revert to nursing facility status after one year of licensure as basic care beds.
label: BODY

text: Nursing facility beds that are converted to basic care may be transferred as basic
label: BODY

text: care beds. However, upon the transfer, the basic care beds may not be relicensed
label: BODY

text: as nursing facility beds.
label: BODY

text: If an Indian tribe acquires nursing facility beds, the tribal facility must meet state
label: BODY

text: licensing requirements for those beds within forty-eight months of acquisition.
label: BODY

text: tribal facility may seek to participate in the medical assistance programs.
label: BODY

text: Medical
label: BODY

text: assistance payments may only be made to a medicaid certified tribal facility that
label: BODY

text: agrees to participate and adhere to all federal and state requirements of the medical
label: BODY

text: assistance program, including participation, screening, ratesetting, and licensing
label: BODY

text: requirements.
label: BODY

text: Existing medical hospitals.
label: BODY

text: Institutions subject to this chapter which are
label: BODY

text: already in operation at the time of enactment of this chapter must be given a reasonable time,
label: BODY

text: not to exceed one year from the date of the enactment of this chapter, within which to comply
label: BODY

text: with the rules, regulations, and minimum standards provided for herein.
label: BODY

text: Application for license - License fee.
label: BODY

text: Applicants for license shall file
label: BODY

text: applications under oath with the state department of health upon forms prescribed. Applications
label: BODY

text: must be signed by the owner, or in the case of a corporation by two of its officers, or in the case
label: BODY

text: Page No. 1
label: BODY

text: of a county or municipal unit by the head of the governmental department having jurisdiction over
label: BODY

text: it. Applications must set forth the full name and address of the owner of the institution for which
label: BODY

text: license is sought, the names of the persons in control thereof, and such additional information as
label: BODY

text: the state department of health may require, including affirmative evidence of ability to comply
label: BODY

text: with such minimum standards, rules, and regulations as may be lawfully prescribed pursuant to
label: BODY

text: this section.
label: BODY

text: An application for a license for facilities not owned by the state or its political
label: BODY

text: subdivisions must be accompanied by the following fees:
label: BODY

text: For each licensed acute care bed, ten dollars.
label: BODY

text: For each licensed skill care bed, ten dollars.
label: BODY

text: License fees collected pursuant to this section must be deposited in the state department of
label: BODY

text: health services operating fund in the state treasury and any expenditure from the fund is subject
label: BODY

text: to appropriation by the legislative assembly.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-04. Licenses. Licenses issued hereunder expire one year after date of issuance
label: BODY

text: or upon such uniform dates annually, as the health council may prescribe by rule. Licenses must
label: BODY

text: be issued only for the premises and persons named in the application and are not transferable or
label: BODY

text: assignable. Licenses must be posted in a conspicuous place on the licensed premises.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-05. Inspections, consultations, and approval of plans. The state department
label: BODY

text: of health shall make or cause to be made such inspections as may be prescribed by regulation.
label: BODY

text: The health council may prescribe by regulations that any licensee or prospective applicant
label: BODY

text: desiring to make a substantial alteration or addition to its facilities or to construct new facilities
label: BODY

text: shall, before commencing such alteration, addition, or new construction, submit plans and
label: BODY

text: specifications
label: BODY

text: therefor
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: state
label: BODY

text: department
label: BODY

text: health
label: BODY

text: for
label: BODY

text: preliminary
label: BODY

text: inspection,
label: BODY

text: recommendation, and approval.
label: BODY

text: Authority to issue, deny, suspend, or revoke licenses.
label: BODY

text: The state
label: BODY

text: department of health shall issue licenses for the operation of institutions subject to this chapter
label: BODY

text: which are found to comply with the provisions of this chapter and such regulations as are lawfully
label: BODY

text: promulgated by the health council. The state health officer with the approval of the health council
label: BODY

text: may, after a hearing, suspend or revoke licenses issued hereunder on any of the following
label: BODY

text: grounds:
label: BODY

text: Violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or the rules and regulations
label: BODY

text: promulgated pursuant thereto.
label: BODY

text: Permitting, aiding, or abetting the commission of any unlawful act.
label: BODY

text: Conduct or practices detrimental to the health or safety of patients and employees of
label: BODY

text: said institutions; provided that this provision may not be construed to have any
label: BODY

text: reference to practices authorized by law; and provided further that no license may be
label: BODY

text: suspended or revoked for any trivial violation.
label: BODY

text: No application for a license may be denied, or any licenses suspended or revoked, except after a
label: BODY

text: hearing before the health council held pursuant to written notice to the applicant or licensee,
label: BODY

text: served by registered or certified mail, which notice must concisely state the grounds for such
label: BODY

text: denial or for such proposed suspension or revocation and must fix the time and place of hearing
label: BODY

text: which may not be less than thirty days after the date of the mailing of such notice. After such
label: BODY

text: hearing, the council shall make an order, either denying the application for license or granting the
label: BODY

text: same, or suspending or revoking such license, or dismissing the proceedings to suspend or
label: BODY

text: revoke as the merits of the case warrant.
label: BODY

text: The council shall send a copy of its order to the
label: BODY

text: applicant or licensee by registered or certified mail, which must contain its findings and
label: BODY

text: conclusions, and such order, except an order of dismissal, becomes final thirty days after the
label: BODY

text: date of mailing unless the applicant or licensee appeals therefrom in the manner provided by
label: BODY

text: section 23-16-10.
label: BODY

text: Page No. 2
label: BODY

text: 23-16-07. Not applicable to certain laws. This chapter may not be construed in any
label: HH1

text: way to restrict or modify any law pertaining to the placement and adoption of children or the care
label: BODY

text: of unmarried mothers.
label: BODY

text: Offering or advertising to dispose of infants prohibited.
label: BODY

text: No hospital
label: BODY

text: providing maternity care may in any way offer to dispose of any child or advertise that it will give
label: BODY

text: children for adoption or hold itself out, directly or indirectly, as being able to dispose of children,
label: BODY

text: however, such hospitals may inform an unmarried mother of child-placing agencies licensed by
label: BODY

text: the department of human services.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-08.1. Access to pharmacist. Irrespective of the type of distribution system used,
label: BODY

text: no person may refuse to allow a resident of a nursing home, as defined in subsection 3 of section
label: BODY

text: 43-34-01, to choose a pharmacist of the resident's choice for the compounding and dispensing of
label: BODY

text: drugs pursuant to chapter 43-15.
label: BODY

text: Information confidential.
label: BODY

text: Information other than reports relating to vital
label: BODY

text: statistics received by the state department of health through inspection or otherwise, authorized
label: BODY

text: under this chapter are confidential and may not be disclosed publicly except in a proceeding
label: BODY

text: involving the question of license. No agent of the state department of health or of any board of
label: BODY

text: health, may disclose individually identifiable health information of such an institution obtained in
label: BODY

text: the course of a survey or inspection except in a judicial or administrative proceeding in response
label: BODY

text: to an order of a court or administrative tribunal.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-10. Appeal. An appeal may be taken to the district court from any order of the
label: BODY

text: state health officer or health council denying an application for a license to operate a medical
label: BODY

text: hospital or related institution, or suspending or revoking a license, or from any order denying an
label: BODY

text: application for a construction project. Any such appeal must be taken in the manner provided in
label: BODY

text: chapter 28-32.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-11. Penalties.
label: BODY

text: Any person establishing, conducting, managing, or operating any institution subject
label: BODY

text: to this chapter, without first obtaining a license as required by this chapter, or who
label: BODY

text: violates any of the provisions of this chapter is guilty of an infraction.
label: BODY

text: In addition to any criminal sanctions that may be imposed pursuant to law, any
label: BODY

text: person maintaining or operating a nursing facility licensed by the department who is
label: BODY

text: found guilty of knowingly violating any provision of this title or any rules adopted
label: BODY

text: under this title, or any person maintaining or operating a nursing facility found to
label: BODY

text: have deficiencies during a survey of the nursing facility, may be assessed a civil
label: BODY

text: penalty not to exceed one thousand dollars for each violation and for each day the
label: BODY

text: violation continues plus interest and any costs incurred by the department to enforce
label: BODY

text: this penalty. This civil penalty may be imposed by a court in a civil proceeding or by
label: BODY

text: the state health officer through an administrative hearing under chapter 28-32. If a
label: BODY

text: civil penalty levied by the department after an administrative hearing is not paid
label: BODY

text: within thirty days after a final determination that a civil penalty is owed, unless the
label: BODY

text: determination of a civil penalty is appealed to a district court, the civil penalty and
label: BODY

text: any costs incurred by the department to enforce the penalty may be withheld from
label: BODY

text: payments due to the person or nursing facility from the department of human
label: BODY

text: services. Any funds received as penalties must be applied to protect residents of
label: BODY

text: the nursing facility, to relocate residents, to maintain operation of the nursing facility,
label: BODY

text: and to reimburse residents for loss of personal funds.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-12. Injunction. The state department of health, in accordance with the laws of the
label: BODY

text: state governing injunctions and other process, may maintain an action in the name of the state
label: BODY

text: against any person, partnership, association, corporation, or limited liability company for
label: BODY

text: establishing, conducting, managing, or operating any hospital within the meaning of the chapter
label: BODY

text: without first having a license therefor as herein provided or without first obtaining from the state
label: BODY

text: Page No. 3
label: BODY

text: department of health written approval of plans and specifications for major alterations of,
label: BODY

text: additions to, or construction of health facilities.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-13. Appropriation. Repealed by omission from this code.
label: BODY

text: Participation in abortion - Not mandatory. No hospital, physician, nurse,
label: BODY

text: hospital employee, nor any other person is under any duty, by law or contract, nor may such
label: BODY

text: hospital or person in any circumstances be required to participate in the performance of an
label: BODY

text: abortion, if such hospital or person objects to such abortion. No such person or institution may
label: BODY

text: be discriminated against because the person or institution so objects.
label: BODY

text: 23-16-15. Umbilical cord blood donation.
label: BODY

text: Unless it is medically inadvisable, a hospital shall allow a pregnant patient to arrange
label: BODY

text: for the blood extracted from the umbilical cord of the patient's newborn child to be
label: BODY

text: donated to a public cord blood bank. A patient who agrees to donate cord blood to a
label: BODY

text: public cord blood bank may not be charged for the costs of collecting, storing, or
label: BODY

text: transporting the cord blood.
label: BODY

text: A hospital is not required to collect cord blood if in the professional judgment of a
label: BODY

text: licensed physician the collection of the cord blood would threaten the health of the
label: BODY

text: mother or newborn child.
label: BODY

text: This section does not require a hospital or hospital
label: BODY

text: employee, including a physician, nurse, or other medical staff, to collect cord blood if
label: BODY

text: the collection of cord blood conflicts with the bona fide religious practices and beliefs
label: BODY

text: of the hospital or hospital employee.
label: BODY

text: This section does not require a hospital to
label: BODY

text: arrange for the donation of blood extracted from umbilical cords.
label: BODY

label: BODY
